qas.question: What is the name of the a cappella musical that debuted Off-Broadway in the same year as Perfect Harmony?
Where does most of In Transit take place?

answers.text: the New York City subway system

qas.question: What a cappella vocal style is implemented in many of In Transit's songs?
How many Lucille Lortel Awards was In Transit nominated for?
What is the name of the actor who played the subway beat boxer?
What role is set in the NY subway system?
When did Chesney Snow premier Off-Broadway?

plausible_answers.text: Kristen Anderson-Lopez, James-Allen Ford, Russ Kaplan, and Sara Wordsworth

qas.question: Who were involved in the production of Primary Stages?
What does Russ Kaplan incorporate in his performance?
When is Primary Stages set to reopen according to the website?

context: The fourth a cappella musical to appear Off-Broadway, <a0_0><b5_0>In Transit<b5_0/><a0_0/>, premiered <b6_0>5 October 2010<b6_0/> and was produced by Primary Stages with book, music, and lyrics by <b7_0>Kristen Anderson-Lopez, James-Allen Ford, Russ Kaplan, and Sara Wordsworth<b7_0/>. Set primarily in <a1_0>the New York City subway system<a1_0/> its score features an eclectic mix of musical genres (including jazz, hip hop, Latin, rock, and country). In Transit incorporates <b8_0>vocal <a2_0>beat boxing<b8_0/><a2_0/> into its contemporary a cappella arrangements through the use of a subway beat boxer character. Beat boxer and actor <a4_0>Chesney Snow<a4_0/> performed this role for the 2010 Primary Stages production. According to the show's website, it is scheduled to reopen for an open-ended commercial run <b9_0>in the Fall of 2011<b9_0/>. In 2011 the production received <a3_0>four<a3_0/> Lucille Lortel Award nominations including Outstanding Musical, Outer Critics Circle and Drama League nominations, as well as five Drama Desk nominations including Outstanding Musical and won for Outstanding Ensemble Performance.
